item.title: Potes
item.description: A tour of Potes with 21 film photos. Potes is a picturesque town in the foothills of the Picos de Europa mountain range, offering history, stunning natural scenery and outdoor recreational opportunities.

item.title: Mamiya RB67
item.description: About the Mamiya RB67, a legendary medium-format film camera that has gained immense popularity among professional photographers and enthusiasts since its introduction in 1970.

item.title: Ronda
item.description: Find out about Ronda in Spain, known for its stunning scenery, rich history, and cultural heritage - includes fifteen film photos of the most famous landmarks.

item.title: Mogarraz
item.description: Twenty black-and-white film photos from Mogarraz taken with vintage cameras. Mogarraz is one of my favourite villages in Spain; it has history, is very picturesque, has a great location, and oozes charm.

item.title: Two Abandoned Cortijos
item.description: Twenty-three photos of two abandoned cortijos taken with a vintage Pentax Spotmatic film camera during a morning walk.

item.title: Harman Phoenix 200 film - roll 3
item.description: All 36 photos from my third roll of Harman Phoenix 200 film, shot mostly on the coast near Motril. I think these are my best Phoenix 200 photos so far.

item.title: Harman Phoenix 200 film – roll 2
item.description: Harman Phoenix 200 is a new colour C41 negative film, full of character and a unique look. See all 36 photos from my second roll of this interesting film.

item.title: Super-Takumar 135mm lens
item.description: The Asahi Optical Co made the Super-Takumar 135mm f3.5 lens in the 60s and 70s for Pentax M42 screw mount cameras.

item.title: Super-Takumar 28mm f3.5 lens
item.description: The Asahi Optical Co made the Super-Takumar 28mm f3.5 lens between 1962 and 1975 for Pentax M42 screw mount cameras.

item.title: Pentax MX
item.description: The Pentax MX was a 35 mm SLR camera manufactured by Asahi Optical Co. between 1976 and 1985. A fully mechanical and well-built camera, highly valued to this day.

item.title: Kodak Six-20 Brownie E
item.description: The Kodak Six-20 Brownie E is a box-type camera from the 1940-50s. The styling is from the early Art Deco period with rounded corners typical of the Streamline Moderne period.

item.title: Privacy Policy
item.description: The Grainy Photos Blog Privacy Policy. The privacy of our visitors is of extreme importance to us. The purpose of this Privacy Policy is to inform you…

item.title: The 100 year old camera project
item.description: Using and taking photos with a 100 year old ICA Lloyd 510 camera.

item.title: Zeiss Ikon Ikoflex IIa 855/16 Camera
item.description: The Zeiss Ikon Ikoflex IIa 855/16 is a simple twin-lens reflex (TLR) camera, almost spartan, with good clean lines.

item.title: About
item.description: About me, my interests and how the Grainy Photos blog came about.

item.title: Frigiliana
item.description: Frigiliana is a picture-postcard white village in Southern Spain - see twenty-four B&W film photos taken with a Mamiya M645 film camera on Ilford FP4 film.

item.title: Harman Phoenix 200 colour film – first impressions
item.description: My first impressions of the Harman Phoenix 200 colour film, a brand-new ISO 200, C41 colour experimental film with high contrast, strong visible grain and loads of character.

item.title: A Sunday stroll on the Via Verde
item.description: Ten photos taken on the Via Verde shot on Kodak Porta 160 film using a Mamiya RB67 camera during a Sunday afternoon stroll.

item.title: Genalgaucil
item.description: Genalguacil is a classic Andalusian white town with a difference - it is famous for its street art! A photo walk with 23 film photos taken with vintage cameras.

item.title: Nerja
item.description: Nerja is a picturesque coastal resort town approximately 50 kilometres east of Málaga, Spain. 16 film photos shot on Ilford FP4 with a Mamiya M645

item.title: Citroen 2CV photos with the Mamiya RB67
item.description: I love classic cars and film cameras, so I jumped at the chance of photographing a Citroën 2CV with my Mamiya RB67 vintage film camera - see all the film photos.

item.title: First film with the Zeiss Ikon Ikoflex IIa 855/16
item.description: Eleven photos of an old Cortijo (Spanish farmhouse) - the first roll of Ilford FP4 film through my Zeiss Ikon Ikoflex IIa.
